document_type: Final Determination Notification and Payroll Authorization Form/Memorandum
security: The document contains Michael Ewing's Social Security number, the public disclosure of which 'could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.'
summary: This document details the Assassination Records Review Board's final determination to postpone in part the release of HSCA staff payroll records, specifically redacting Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. It also includes a payroll authorization form for Michael Ewing and related internal memoranda.
summary_one_paragraph: The Assassination Records Review Board issued a final determination on December 8, 1995, to postpone in part the release of a House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll record due to privacy concerns related to Social Security numbers. The document includes a payroll authorization form dated March 13, 1978, for Michael Ewing to serve as a Senior Researcher with the John F. Kennedy Task Force/HSCA, with a starting salary of $18,000.00, and memoranda regarding payroll certification and Ewing's appointment.
title: Final Determination Notification Regarding HSCA Staff Payroll Records
